## Discussion

Use this property to speed up or slow down the overall behavior of a particle system without changing the many individual properties (such as [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/acceleration], [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/particleAngularVelocity], and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/particleBounce]) that affect the motion of particles.

The default value is 1.0. Lower values slow down the effect; higher values make the effect run faster.

# speedFactor

**Instance Property**

A multiplier for the speed at which SceneKit runs the particle simulation. Animatable.

## Declaration

```swift
var speedFactor: CGFloat { get set }
```

## Discussion

Use this property to speed up or slow down the overall behavior of a particle system without changing the many individual properties (such as [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/acceleration], [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/particleAngularVelocity], and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/particleBounce]) that affect the motion of particles.

The default value is 1.0. Lower values slow down the effect; higher values make the effect run faster.

You can animate changes to this property’s value. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/animating-scenekit-content].

## Controlling Particle Simulation

- **isLocal**: A Boolean value that specifies whether the particle simulation runs in the local coordinate space of the node containing it.
- **reset()**: Returns the particle system to its initial state.
